questions.explanation: Natural numbers begin from 1 and continue onward without decimals or fractions.

question.text: The set of whole numbers includes all natural numbers and _______.

questions.explanation: Whole numbers are natural numbers plus zero.

question.text: An example of an even number is _______.

questions.explanation: Even numbers are divisible by 2 without a remainder.

question.text: The number _______ is the only even prime number.

questions.explanation: 2 is the smallest and only even number that is prime.

question.text: Numbers that have exactly two distinct factors (1 and itself) are called _______ numbers.

questions.explanation: Prime numbers have exactly two distinct divisors: 1 and the number itself.

question.text: The number _______ is neither prime nor composite.

questions.explanation: 1 is a unique number that is not classified as either prime or composite.

question.text: The place value of 5 in the number 4527 is _______.

questions.explanation: In the number 4527, the digit 5 is in the hundreds place, so its place value is 500.

question.text: All numbers divisible by 2 are called _______ numbers.

questions.explanation: Even numbers are divisible by 2 with no remainder.

question.text: The difference between the greatest and smallest 2-digit number is _______.

questions.explanation: Greatest 2-digit number is 99, smallest is 10, so 99 - 10 = 89.

question.text: The face value of 7 in the number 379 is _______.

questions.explanation: Face value of a digit is the digit itself, regardless of position.
